Class oracle.html.HtmlPage 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index  OWS Table of Contents

Class oracle.html.HtmlPage 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----oracle.html.HtmlPage
public class HtmlPage
extends Object
implements IHtmlItem

Description:

HtmlPage encapsulates an HTML Page

There are 3 types of Html Page one can create using this package:

  1. Ordinary Html Page -- consists of one HtmlHead and one HtmlBody
  2. Frame-oriented page -- consists of one HtmlHead and one Frameset
  3. Legacy Html page -- this allows you to import an existing HTML page as an HtmlPage object, plus the capability to change part of the legacy Html page

Example: 

// Create a normal Html Page
// Create the Head object with title "Welcome to our home page"
HtmlHead head = new HtmlHead("Welcome to our home page");
// Create the Body object
HtmlBody body = new HtmlBody();
// Now creates the page
HtmlPage page = new HtmlPage(head, body);

See Also:
HtmlHead, HtmlBody, HtmlFile, Frameset, Frame, Color

FILE_DOC
Legacy html page
FRAME_DOC
Frame based page
NORMAL_DOC
Normal Html Page

HtmlPage(int, HtmlHead, HtmlBody, Frameset, File)
Creates an HtmlPage object
HtmlPage()
Creates an HtmlPage object
Note:
This will create an HtmlPage of type NORMAL_DOC with a default HtmlHead and a default empty HtmlBody.
HtmlPage(HtmlHead, HtmlBody)
Creates an HtmlPage Object
HtmlPage(HtmlHead, Frameset)
Creates an HtmlPage Object with Frameset instead of Body
Note:
Implicit type of this object instance is FRAME_DOC.
HtmlPage(String)
Creates an HtmlPage with the specified Title
HtmlPage(File)
Creates an HtmlPage object that imports a legacy HTML file

addItem(IHtmlItem)
Add an item to the BODY of this page
endTag()
Returns the end Tag of this page
getBody()
Gets the BODY element of this page
getHead()
Gets the HEAD element of this page
print()
Prints content of this page (as HTML) to System.out
Note:
In most cases where you want to dynamically generate HTML using HtmlPage, you need to call the method printHeader() before you call print().
printHeader()
Print out Header information of this page.

NORMAL_DOC 
  public final static int NORMAL_DOC
Normal Html Page
FRAME_DOC 
  public final static int FRAME_DOC
Frame based page
FILE_DOC 
  public final static int FILE_DOC
Legacy html page

HtmlPage 
  public HtmlPage(int type,
                  HtmlHead head,
                  HtmlBody body,
                  Frameset frameset,
                  File file)
Creates an HtmlPage object
Parameters:
type - the type of this document (NORMAL_DOC, FRAME_DOC, or FILE_DOC)
head - the HEAD section of this document
body - the BODY section of this document
frameset - the FRAMESET section of this document
file - the legacy HTML file to be imported Note:
If you specify FRAME_DOC as the type of this document object, the body argument will be ignored.
HtmlPage 
  public HtmlPage()
Creates an HtmlPage object
Note:
This will create an HtmlPage of type NORMAL_DOC with a default HtmlHead and a default empty HtmlBody.
HtmlPage 
  public HtmlPage(HtmlHead head,
                  HtmlBody body)
Creates an HtmlPage Object
Parameters:
head - HtmlHead object
body - HtmlBody object Note:
Implicit type of this object instance is NORMAL_DOC.
HtmlPage 
  public HtmlPage(HtmlHead head,
                  Frameset frameset)
Creates an HtmlPage Object with Frameset instead of Body
Note:
Implicit type of this object instance is FRAME_DOC.
